intro: Thermopsis bargusinensis, commonly known as the Bargusin yellowroot, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to harsh alpine environments. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and the flowers are clustered in racemes, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
